channel.title: Gateway apt dist-upgrade hangs on update Build initial module - Solution in Post Number 2
channel.description:
today i update my whonix Whonix-XFCE-15 gateway. Now it hangs on: Build initial module for 4.19.0-8-amd64
After a restart i have tried: sudo dpkg --configure -a but it hangs on Build initial module for 4.19.0-8-amd64 also.
i have waited about 15 minutes and nothing happens.
What can i do to fix it?

item.title: Gateway apt dist-upgrade hangs on update Build initial module - Solution in Post Number 2
item.dc:creator: ef86
item.description:
Ohhh yes, thank you very much for the Information Patrick! I set the RAM to 1300! Now it runs perfectly! Thank you very much for the very fast and good Support! GREAT!

ef86

Read full topic

item.title: Gateway apt dist-upgrade hangs on update Build initial module - Solution in Post Number 2
item.dc:creator: hangup
item.description:
Upon starting up both machines, it’s all smooth. Once inside them, things get a little bit slower. Problem started when tried to upgrade the distro and the gateway became unresponsive after downloading all updates.

Could this be due to a slower drive running at 5400 rpm?

Screen Capture:
i[dot]ibb[dot]co/0hBkHdy/IMG-065.png

Read full topic

item.title: Gateway apt dist-upgrade hangs on update Build initial module - Solution in Post Number 2
item.dc:creator: mikelosat
item.description:
Hi friends, after a few days I tried to update my whonix gateway and when I type “sudo apt-get dist-upgrade” the update, the console freezes.

I tried to restart the gateway and give the command: sudo dpkg --configure -a. Unfortunately, the result does not change.

Read full topic

item.title: Gateway apt dist-upgrade hangs on update Build initial module - Solution in Post Number 2
item.dc:creator: Patrick_mobile
item.description:
Generally:

It is absolutely crucial to subscribe to and read the latest Whonix news category ‘important-news’ to stay in touch with ongoing developments. This way users benefit from notifications concerning important security vulnerabilities, potential upgrade issues and improved releases which address identified issues, like those affecting the updater or other core elements.

whonix.org – 1 Mar 20

Follow Whonix ™ Developments - Whonix

It is absolutely crucial to subscribe to and read the latest Whonix news category 'important-news' to stay in touch with ongoing developments. This way users benefit from notifications concerning important security vulnerabilities, potential upgrade...

Specifically:

Whonix XFCE for VirtualBox users: RAM increase required News
Releases of Whonix-Gateway XFCE prior build version 15.0.0.8.9: Virtual (VM) RAM increase to 1280 MB RAM advised. [1] Otherwise APT upgrades might freeze during module building (VirtualBox guest additions) as well as kernel header package upgrade. [2] To change RAM setting: Power off the virtual machine. Open VirtualBox. Go to VirtualBox machine settings → System → Base Memory → Increase RAM by moving the slider or type 1280. Ignore message about invalid graphics controller VMSVGA because, …

Read full topic
